topic.title: DemoHouse: collection of JavaScript, CSS3, Canvas, SVG and Web Animation demos.
topic.body:
Demos are all independent and guess they should be able to directly use for building ZeroNet site.
Weirdly the origin project (quite famous) has been deleted from github, so the link below is a fork. Licence is MIT.
https://github.com/opt-luo/DemoHouse

topic.title: ZeroMe Feed Bot
topic.body:
This is a python script that will turn a ZeroMe Profile into a RSS feed reader.

> RSS (Rich Site Summary; originally RDF Site Summary; often called Really Simple Syndication) uses a family of standard web feed formats to publish frequently updated information: blog entries, news headlines, audio, video. An RSS document (called "feed", "web feed", or "channel") includes full or summarized text, and metadata, like publishing date and author's name. [Src:Wiki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSS)

[How to Subscribe to RSS Feeds](http://rss-tutorial.com/rss-how-to-subscribe-to-feeds.htm)

## How to Install:

1.  Backup your `/path/to/zeronet/data/users.json`, delete it and restart ZeroNet. Create a new ID (ZeroID, [KaffieID](/id.kaffie.bit/), etc).
    Clone a hub (**Don't mess up existing hub, newcomers will be disappointed when they find only Robots and Zombies in the public timeline. Also you can control your post storage limit with your own hub, or suffer this `content.json: Include too large 277327 > 50000 ... Sign failed: Invalid content` XD**), then login ZeroMe with your new ID and your hub.

2.  Create a folder named `FeedBot` under your ZeroNet root directory:
    `$ cd /path/to/zeronet && mkdir FeedBot`
    Download [the script file ↗](https://git.gnu.io/chbinnc/Userscripts/raw/master/FeedBot/feedbot.py) or [copy it from Nullpaste](/1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz/?user_binchan2@zeroid.bit) to the folder, also under `FeedBot` folder create an empty file named with `rssAddresses.txt`.

    PS: One-line command : `$ cd /path/to/zeronet && mkdir FeedBot && cd FeedBot && touch rssAddresses.txt && wget https://git.gnu.io/chbinnc/Userscripts/raw/master/FeedBot/feedbot.py`

3.  Add your feeds:
    There are two way to add your feeds:
    One way is to directly copy your feed url to `rssAddresses.txt`, one url one line.
    The other way is to create post with your bot ZeroMe account. The format is `add-feed YOUR_FEED_URL`. Your can also delete your feed with `del-feed URL`. That's cool, isn't it ;) You can also use your major ZeroMe account to add and delete feed url. Check the code to add the feature by yourself :P

4.  Backup `/path/to/zeronet/data/users.json` (You need to copy your bot site address, id auth address and auth key later when first time running the script), restore your major `users.json` and restart ZeroNet.

5.  Run the script:
    Install package dependency `feedparser`: `$ pip install feedparser` or with other method. Then simply run it with `$ python feedbot.py`. If you want to run it periodically, you can use `$ watch -n TIME_INTERVAL_IN_SECOND -x python feedbot.py`. The script normally won't fetch anything if there are no new content. But some websites don't support `etag` and `last-modified header`, the script has to always fetch feeds from them, but still won't update anything.
    PS: On my Raspberry pi 2 `watch` doesn't work together with `tmux`, so I use this one instead: `$ while sleep TIME_INTERVAL_IN_SECOND; do python feedbot.py; done`.

## Screenshot:

[Screenshot](/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/merged-ZeroMe/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/data/users/1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h/1492140736.jpg)
![Bildschirmfoto_2017-04-14_09-42-10.png (24x24)](data/img/post_22_Bildschirmfoto_2017-04-14_09-42-10.png)

## Bugs and Troubleshooting:

### 1\. The script sometimes hangs up.

Official `feedparser` package [doesn't support timeout setting](https://github.com/kurtmckee/feedparser/pull/80), so you need to install it from another branch. How to:

1.  Uninstall the package if you've installed it: `$ pip uninstall feedparser`.
2.  Clone the branch with timeout function and install it (Default is 30 seconds, check [this](https://github.com/kurtmckee/feedparser/pull/80)): `$ git clone https://github.com/JPFrancoia/feedparser && cd feedparser && python setup.py install --user`

Note: There is another solution by using `requests` library instead [[1]](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9772691/feedparser-with-timeout) [[2]](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/27621689/not-getting-a-304-response-even-after-adding-etag-header), I will check it later^TM if I have time.


## Todo:

*   ~~Also add Feed Summary (300-500 character limit).~~
*   Keyword filters especially for large websites.
*   Remove posts with keyword
*   Set limit of post size
*   Any recommendation?

## License:

MIT

topic.title: ZeroMe Mastodon Bridge
topic.body:
Another python script :3 This script gives you the power to cross post between ZeroMe and Mastodon, which means when you post something on ZeroMe, it will also post to your Mastodon account, and vice versa.

What is Mastodon? It's a Twitter-like, that based on OStatus protocol, distributed social network, and recently its user base and development are exploding. For more information check [its github repository](https://github.com/tootsuite/mastodon/).

## Screenshot:

[Screenshot](/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/merged-ZeroMe/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/data/users/1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h/1493424295.jpg)
![Bildschirmfoto_2017-04-28_23-03-49.png (24x24)](data/img/post_23_Bildschirmfoto_2017-04-28_23-03-49.png)

## How to Install - ZeroMe Mastodon Bridge:

Unlike Feedbot.py, this time the installation is quite simple. First you need to have an account from [a Mastodon instance](https://github.com/tootsuite/documentation/blob/master/Using-Mastodon/List-of-Mastodon-instances.md). Then create a folder named `ZeroMeMastodonBridge` under your ZeroNet root directory (Or simply use the FeedBot folder if you have created one):
`$ cd /path/to/zeronet && mkdir ZeroMeMastodonBridge`
Download [the script file ↗](https://git.gnu.io/chbinnc/Userscripts/raw/master/ZeroMeMastodonBridge/zerome_mastodon_bridge.py) or [copy it from Nullpaste](/1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz/?user_binchan2@zeroid.bit) to the folder, then install dependent packages `html2text` and `Mastodon.py` like with `$ pip install html2text --user && pip install Mastodon.py --user`. That's all.

Run the script with `$ python zerome_mastodon_bridge.py`, just at the first time it will ask you to input your hub `address`, ID `auth_address`, ID `auth_privatekey` (you can find them in the `users.json`) and your Mastodon instance website address, your username and password of your Mastodon account.

You can keep repeating the script with `$ while sleep TIME_INTERVAL_IN_SECOND; do python zerome_mastodon_bridge.py; done`.

PS: The script also supports to set last timestamps without cross-posting anything, with command: `$ cd /path/to/zeronet/ZeroMeMastodonBridge && python -c 'from zeronet_mastodon_bridge import initGlobalName, setLastTimestamp; initGlobalName(); setLastTimestamp()'`

## How to Install - ZeroMe Gnusocial Bridge:

The process is similar to "ZeroMe Mastodon Bridge", but in addition you need to create an
access token dict: First register an OAuth client applicant from Settings -> Connections, then check [https://pythonhosted.org/gnusocial/oauth.html](https://pythonhosted.org/gnusocial/oauth.html) to get the access_token dict. Finally copy & paste the dict when running the script at the first time. [Script file ↗](https://git.gnu.io/chbinnc/Userscripts/raw/master/ZeroMeMastodonBridge/zerome_gnusocial_bridge.py)

For Markdown support, add [this](https://git.gnu.io/chimo/markdown), and enable it in Settings.

## Bugs and Troubleshooting:

1.  Currently Mastodon doesn't support markdown, so your post from ZeroMe to Mastodon won't be well formatted. But in contrast post from Mastodon to ZeroMe will be formatted, thanks to `html2text`, though it may still have some bugs. Also Mastodon limits post to 500 characters by default.

## Todo^TM:

*   Image support is possible ...
*   ZeroMe API

## License:

MIT

## A Small Proposal:

Currently ZeroMe still has not many users (though I also like small community), and most hubs have quite heavy limit to content size. But I believe ZeroMe is still quite a promising project . Besides keep improving performance and adding functions, similiar to using same protocol like traditional email service, Diaspora* with Friendica (Friendica also supports connecting to many other websites, before it could also hack Facebook, but later Facebook built some high wall...) and Hubzilla, Mastodon with StatusNet, Gnusocial and Quitter. In the long term it may be better that ZeroMe and ZeroNet can communicate with other distributed (social) network, or just P2P (social) network. Therefore ZeroMe and ZeroNet project won't become an isolated island.

topic.title: Language Sorting for ZeroTalk
Rebranded Feedbot for ZeroTalk :3
topic.body:
Still remember [my ZeroMe Feedbot](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:3_1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h/ZeroMe+Feed+Bot), here is a rebranded feedbot for ZeroTalk :3
The installation will be a little easier because you don't need to create another ID.

A python 3 script that will turn a ZeroTalk clone into a RSS feed bot and more.

> RSS (Rich Site Summary; originally RDF Site Summary; often called Really Simple Syndication) uses a family of standard web feed formats to publish frequently updated information: blog entries, news headlines, audio, video. An RSS document (called "feed", "web feed", or "channel") includes full or summarized text, and metadata, like publishing date and author's name. [Src:Wiki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSS)

[How to Subscribe to RSS Feeds](http://rss-tutorial.com/rss-how-to-subscribe-to-feeds.htm)

## How to Install:

1.  Clone a ZeroTalk, then login your ZeroTalk with your ID and create a random topic to generate your profile. Then you may like to edit `/path/to/your/zerotalk/data/users/content.json` and change the `max_size`, or your data.json will fail to sign if it reaches the limit. After changing the `max_size`, you need to sign (and publish) your ZeroTalk from the right config panel (drag the '0' button to left).

2.  Add [Git Center](/gitcenter.bit/) and [my messy repo](/13zzNGxEXDeLxHEGZdG3mE7G8dChf45LrV), clone my messy repo: `git clone /path/to/zeronet/data/13zzNGxEXDeLxHEGZdG3mE7G8dChf45LrV/binchan-s-messy-repo.git`, then copy `FeedBot-ZeroTalk` folder in my repo to your ZeroNet root directory.

3.  Add your feeds:
    There are two way to add your feeds:
    One way is to directly copy your feed url to `rssAddresses.txt`, one url one line.
    The other way is by creating a topic with your bot ZeroTalk account. The title format is `add-feed YOUR_FEED_URL`. Your can also delete your feed with `del-feed URL`. That's cool, isn't it ;)
    Check [this article](/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/?Post:25:Directly+Parsing+Website+Content+to+Feedbot) if you want something like a torrent site with magnet link. To use it you also need to create a file named `htmlAddresses.txt` in the `FeedBot-ZeroTalk` folder.

4.  Run the script:
    Install package dependency `feedparser`, `html2text` and `beautifulsoup4`:
    ```
pip3 install html2text beautifulsoup4 --user
    ```
    For `feedparser`, clone the branch with timeout function (Check Bug and Troubleshooting below) and install it (Default is 30 seconds, check [this](https://github.com/kurtmckee/feedparser/pull/80)): `$ git clone https://github.com/JPFrancoia/feedparser && cd feedparser && python3 setup.py install --user`. Then simply run it with `$ python3 feedbot.py` .
If you want to run it periodically, you can use `$ while sleep TIME_INTERVAL_IN_SECOND; do python3 feedbot.py; done`. If your system uses `systemd`, you can check [this](/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/?Post:24:ZeroNet+Systemd+Service+and+Timer).
The script normally won't fetch anything if there are no new content. But some websites don't support `etag` and `last-modified header`, the script has to always fetch feeds from them, but still won't update anything.

5.  If you want to create a ZeroTalk group like [P2P news flow](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topics:1_1KbV1e1u6P6AsY8XNBydgtbtN8iSB5WMyG/P2P+news+flow), you can edit `/path/to/your/zerotalk/data/users/YOUR_AUTH_ADDRESS/data.json` and add `"type": "group",` to a topic you created, also copy the `topic_id`, uncomment `#'parent_topic_uri': 'TOPIC_ID' + '_' + AUTH_ADDRESS` in the feedbot.py and change `TOPIC_ID` respectively.

## Bugs and Troubleshooting:

### 1\. The script sometimes hangs up.

Official `feedparser` package [doesn't support timeout setting](https://github.com/kurtmckee/feedparser/pull/80), so you need to install it from another branch. How to:

1.  Uninstall the package if you've installed it: `$ pip uninstall feedparser`.
2.  Clone the branch with timeout function and install it (Default is 30 seconds, check [this](https://github.com/kurtmckee/feedparser/pull/80)): `$ git clone https://github.com/JPFrancoia/feedparser && cd feedparser && python3 setup.py install --user`

Note: There is another solution by using `requests` library instead [[1]](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9772691/feedparser-with-timeout) [[2]](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/27621689/not-getting-a-304-response-even-after-adding-etag-header), I will check it later^TM if I have time.

## Todo^TM:

*   Remove posts with keyword
*   Set limit of post size
*   Any recommendation?

## License:

MIT

topic.title: The Ultimate ZeroNet Mobile Guide
topic.body:
## How to Access:

*   Access by local wifi:
    If you are using ZeroNet inside home wifi, you can start zeronet with `$ python2 /path/to/zeronet/zeronet.py --ui_retrict ip1 ip2 --ui_ip MY_Local_static_ip`, `ip1` `ip2` is your mobile devices ip, `My_Local_static_ip` is your ZeroNet PC ip. Also you should bind your ip to your devices in the router config panel. [[ref - Is it possible to install ZeroNet to a remote machine?]](https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq/)

    Also with a terminal app like [ConnectBot](https://f-droid.org/packages/org.connectbot/) or [Termux](https://f-droid.org/packages/com.termux/), you can use [the method](/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/12h51ug6CcntU2aiBjhP8Ns2e5VypbWWtv/1GnJD7CXskmG8GywMbTvbP12wneCFW9XzR/1483533203) mentioned by weakish:
    > Alternatively, you can just start ZeroNet on remote machine as normal, without --ui_ip, UiPassword, reverse proxy, SSL, etc.
    > And run this command at local machine:
    > `ssh -L 43110:127.0.0.1:43110 -N username@remote`
    > Then you can just access [http://127.0.0.1:43110/](http://127.0.0.1:43110/) on your local machine, securely.

*   Access by [ZeroNet-kivy](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet-kivy), it's also available on [Google Play - ZeroNet4Android](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=net.mkg20001.zeronet)
  **[Alert]**: Currently ZeroNet-kivy stores sensitive data like your users.json as well as your private keys in the internal storge, which can be read by any other apps that have "internel storage" permission. So only use it for testing.

*   Access by [Termux Android](https://f-droid.org/packages/com.termux/), here is [a script](https://github.com/PeterCxy/Termux-ZeroNet) to automate everything. `greenlet` clang patch has been merged to main stream, so you can change it to `pip2 install greenlet` in the script.

*   Access by [SSH tunnel](https://lignux.com/zeronet-en-android/) (Spanish)

*   Access by clearnet proxy [[List of working proxies]](/138R53t3ZW7KDfSfxVpWUsMXgwUnsDNXLP/?Page:proxies)
    Note: if the list is blank or looks incomplete, check `History` for a complete version.

## Mobile Improvement for Zites:

*   ZeroHello, ZeroMe and ZeroTalk are already mobile friendly.

*   ZeroBlog:
    * [Updated ZeroBlog with Tag Index and Mobile Support](/15mSYzsDxzarssqtV1pFPKqoCTaLdjVB2f/)
    * [Minimal and Beautiful ZeroBlog Themed by ZAlex](/1A5nKj7XV3SqU9CdAtpnYu7eqiaSHKcj9X/)
    * [Poster](/1J2ZJjs97wEcW36x5d9f1QnPVPVDv8wbJ/)
        A simple blog platform for ZeroNet written from scratch using Vue.js and Bulma.

*   ZeroMail: [[ZeroMail Mobile Simple Solution]](/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/?Post:40)
    For ZeroMail, the userstyle file is also provided [here](/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/shared/zeronet-mobile.userstyle.css). If you prefer dark theme, check [A Dark Theme for ZeroNet](/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/?Post:3), the mobile improvement is included.

*   Note 1: Besides installing the css code with Stylish, you can directly add it to ZeroMail, create a file named all2.css in `/path/to/zite/css/`, copy the css code (except the first line which starts with `@-moz-document` and the last `}`) to it, then copy `/path/to/zite/index.html` to `/path/to/zite/index2.html`, inside index2.html, change the code

    ```
    ...
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/all.css" />
    ...
    ```

    to

    ```
    ...
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/all.css" />
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/all2.css" />
    ...
    ```

    Then visit your zite and add index2.html at the end of the address. Like `http:/127.0.0.1:43110/Mail.ZeroNetwork.bit//index2.html` for ZeroMail, same with ZeroSites, ZeroBoard, etc.

## Browser Recommendation (Android):

*   [Lightning Browser](https://f-droid.org/packages/acr.browser.lightning/) (recommended by Musickiller): brings really fast experience. Also ZeroChat doesn't work in this browser (Probably because it doesn't support JavaScript class, which was introduced in ES6 (ECMAScript 2015)).
    For privacy concern, you may like to change startpage and default search engine to Duckduckgo or Searx (the query url format is [https://instance.url/?q=](https://instance.url/?q=), I also add `!go !ddg !wp !wd` because Bing and Yahoo suck).

*   [Orfox from Guardian Project](https://guardianproject.info/apps/): Torbrowser for Android, so you can use it to block all harmful clearnet connections, but ZeroMe image upload doesn't work with this browser.
    You need to also install Orbot (Tor android) or Orfox will complain it when starting. After install it, enter `about:config` and search for `no_proxy`, add your remote machine ip and/or localhost like: `192.168.1.xxx:43110, 127.0.0.1:43110`. If you want the Stylish add-on, you can also add the related add-on download address. I use the adb method instead: `adb shell am start -a android.intent.action.VIEW -c android.intent.category.DEFAULT -d file:///mnt/sdcard/Download/ -n info.guardianproject.orfox/.App` [[ref]](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36049137/installing-unsigned-xpis-in-firefox-for-android-version-42-or-newer)

*   [Icecat Mobile](https://f-droid.org/packages/org.gnu.icecat/): 100% freesoftware. For me this one is with the best compatibility. ~~But also the most laggy one...~~ Icecat 52.3 is quite smooth, recommended.

*   Note2: If the font size is too big or too small, you can change it in Settings.

*   Note3: Some zites may support mobile mode but the owner didn't add viewport setting to it, in this case, you can contact the owner to add `"viewport": "width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0",` in her/his content.json [[ref]](https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/site_development/content_json/), or force viewport in your browser: for Lightning Browser, uncheck `Use wide viewport` in Settings -> Display Settings. For Orfox or Icecat Mobile, search `viewport` in `about:config`, then change `browser.viewport.desktopWidth` to a smaller value, for me is 400.

## Issues and Troubleshootings:

*   In some browser the "0" button is not clickable or need to tap twice, so use bookmark to access ZeroHello instead. Also the config panel is not very reactive, so you can try to refresh the screen (like for "This is my site" switcher) or tap the button more than one time to make it work.
*   [Fixed] On ZeroMe Mobile many image previews are blank. Weird bug, but you can still touch the screen twice to get the fullsize image.

## Credits:

*   Thank Nofish and other ZeroNet devs for this awesome project!

*   Thank Mkg20001 for the ZeroNet-kivy app!

*   Also thank every active ZeroNet fellows :3

## Edit:
-
[171117] Polish section - Mobile Improvement for Zites
[291017] Add alert for ZeroNet-kivy Android app. Thank shouko for sharing it.
[030817] Remove "Independent Scroll for Panels in ZeroHello".
[010817] Add `ZeroHello Mobile`, `Minimal and Beautiful ZeroBlog Themed by ZAlex` to Mobile Improvement for Zites. Remove viewport setting suggestion.
[240717] Change Note 1 to a harmless method. Add more explanation to browser recommendation.

topic.title: A Simple ZeroTalk Languages and Keywords Filter Userscript
ZeroNet Dev Board
topic.body: A sub-board for topics related to ZeroNet and Zite Development.

topic.title: A Universal ZeroNet Dark Theme - Re-Edition :3
topic.body:
> White theme is for noob, light theme is for amateur, dark theme is for expert ;)

This userstyle has been actively polished for more than 10 months, should work on all official zites and their clones.
Some unofficial zites are also supported, like NullPaste, ZeroWiki, Kaffiene Search. Nevertheless, some other zites may have side effects - that some bright elements are still not changed. You can try it yourself, ask me to modify them or temporarily disable the theme.

Some devs may find the way I develop this userstyle very stupid, I should be able to automate a lot of things by writing a python script, but I enjoy the procedure like playing jigsaw puzzles, and having some simple time X)

Code theme is Vim Desert.

For Firefox family browser before Firefox 57, you can install it by [Stylish](https://github.com/stylish-userstyles/stylish) plugin/add-on.
For Chrome family browser, you can use [Stylus](https://github.com/openstyles/stylus). The Chrome version of Stylish and the Firefox version newer than 3.xx is not recommended, as it's not opensource and has [an opt-out option to collect user data](https://malwaretips.com/threads/stylish-browser-add-on-2-million-users-impacted-by-new-data-collection-policy.67191/), and I confirm that even I uncheck the data collection option, every time I start Inox (an ungoogled Chromium) it will connect to google-analytics. Even so use a firefox family browser if you care your privacy.

Currently Stylus Beta is available for Firefox 57, but in my version ([Iceweasel](https://wiki.parabola.nu/Iceweasel), Debian's rebranded version from Firefox), it doesn't work for ZeroNet. There is another add-on called [xStyle](https://github.com/FirefoxBar/xStyle) but it doesn't work, too... So currently there is no solution for Firefox 57.

## How to install:

If you use Firefox (version < 57) and Stylish 2.xx, in the `Manage Styles` Setting you can choose `Install from URLs`, then simply copy [this link](/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/shared/zeronet-dark-theme.userstyle.css) and install it (for NullPaste bin it doesn't work in this way).

If you use Stylus, under `Manage` page, use `Import styles` and import [this file](/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/shared/zeronet-dark-theme-for-import.json), then click the update button to update it to the lastet version. You can also set up auto-update interval under `Options UI`.

If you use remote server mode or clearnet proxy and your ZeroNet address is not `127.0.0.1:43110`, you need to change the addresses below in the json file.

```
...
    "updateUrl": "http://127.0.0.1:43110/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/shared/zeronet-dark-theme.userstyle.json",
    "md5Url": "http://127.0.0.1:43110/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/shared/zeronet-dark-theme.userstyle.md5",
    "url": "http://127.0.0.1:43110/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/?Post:3:A+Dark+Theme+For+ZeroNet",
...
```
In another way you can create a new theme and choose import Mozilla Format from the left panel, then copy & paste the content of [this link](/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/shared/zeronet-dark-theme.userstyle.css), but you need to manually repeat these steps for update.

## Screenshot:
From [my Jekyll Zite](/1ADGCZCvC6wCf5GwCY23H9uwKyRiixoLt6/photos/dark_theme/)

## Other sources:

[My repo](/13zzNGxEXDeLxHEGZdG3mE7G8dChf45LrV) on Git Center. You can track the update log, submit issue and make request there.
[repository on git.gnu.io](https://git.gnu.io/chbinnc/Userscripts/raw/master/Userstyles/zeronet-dark-theme.userstyle.css)
[my gallery](/1ADGCZCvC6wCf5GwCY23H9uwKyRiixoLt6/zeronet-dark-theme.userstyle.css) (Unmaintained, too lazy to update it :3)
[my NullPaste bin](/1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz/?user_binchan2@zeroid.bit) (Unmaintained, too lazy to update it :3)
[userstyle.org](https://userstyles.org/styles/136470/zeronet-dark-theme) (Unmaintained, easy to install but the website contains many third-party javascripts)

Hope you enjoy it :)

topic.title: Setup Unique Tab to ZeroHello for your Zite :3
topic.body:
[Screenshot on ZeroMe](/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h/1509071482)
-
## How:
For dev:
Change  'type' to what you like (whitespace is not allowed) in`feedFollow` cmd [[Ref]](https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/site_development/zeroframe_api_reference/#feedfollow-feeds)
For user (+Level 3 :P):
Backup your `data/users.json`, shutdown ZeroNet, change the `type` of the `follow` item of the zite you want to change, whitespace is not allowed, then restart ZeroNet.

topic.title: Yet another ZeroNet Dev Resources Index
topic.body:
This Index is also available [on ZeroWiki](/138R53t3ZW7KDfSfxVpWUsMXgwUnsDNXLP/?Page:devresources), you can add dev resources there. If you find the page blank or has no enough content, please check history for a good version. Even so you can make request here if you find it useful :)
-
## Docs & References

1.  [ZeroNet Documentation](https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/)

    [Unofficial clone of Documentation on ZeroNet](/1Docsfk5uLvuXkL4U13eYDxCm2gzi1fNQq/) #outdated

2. [ZeroNet Github repo](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/Documentation/)

    [ZeroNet Git Repo hosted on ZeroNet](/1P4w4Rvh4vS9r6G5xTiSh8qEW87EKZtnJB/)
## Tutorials & Learning Resources

1.  [ZeroChat tutorial new](/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:99:ZeroChat+tutorial+new) #official #javascript
2.  [ZeroChat tutorial old](/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:46:ZeroNet+site+development+tutorial+2) #official #coffeescript
3.  [Zeronet Tutorials](/1Jtjb5CU9aod4jtz8hF5NPPqFKofRSsb4x/) #zerowiki #multisource
1.  [The Truth about ZeroNet](https://github.com/krixano/ZeroNet-Dev-Center/issues/28)

     Tutorials and zite examples written by imachug (gitcenter@zeroid.bit), including 13 chapters from understanding basic ZeroNet components to advanced topics like merger sites and merged content. **Great starting point for new developers.**
4.  [Tutorials on ZeroNet Dev Center](/14pM9huTYzJdyQyHRj6v2kfhMe8DrxwpGt/?/tutorials)
5.  [Kopi](/1KtzUsnmwc1Wr7KWWEGnWzmBSQoyH917Pz) 

    Kopi is a ZeroNet boilerplate with all the necessary elements to start a new project without the need to configure and develop the same features again and again.
6. [Zeroframe on NPM](https://www.npmjs.com/package/zeroframe)

7. [Zeronet/React example site](https://github.com/rllola/zeronet-react)

  Get started creating a zeronet site using react. Need to be updated.

1. [Udemy Courses](/udemy.acabin.bit)

  This zite provides magnet URI's for a bunch of udemy courses. Every torrent includes: all videos, all subtitles and all course files.

8. [Github Awesome Meta List](https://github.com/sindresorhus/awesome)

   Just awesome ;)

## Tools & Dev Services

1. [Mavo](/1F6Rt2QNMA6uJTSTZkDNBfXTd3unrtgcdJ/) #official #experimental

     ZeroNet storage plugin for Mavo that allows any web application created for this platform to run in a P2P and decentralized way without any modification. [[ref]](/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:113:ZeroNet+backed+for+Mavo)
1. [0git](/0git.bit/)

   Git repositories hosted on ZeroNet
1.  [CodeR](/1CodEr7T9xNXSPcwbsvf5fHTqsixDMwDzL/)

    JSFiddle and CodePen alternative
1. [Git Center](/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/)

    Git Center is a decentralized hosting platform for Git repositories. Provides several collaboration features such as bug tracking for every project, and private and public repositories.
1. [Git over ZeroNet](/1xxooZ7s8iDz3u56i5mNQ1XGmwF8Zvnw9/)
1. [Static git repository page generator](/stagit.0git.bit/)
2.  [NullPaste](/1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz/) #pastebin
3.  [ZeroDB](/ZeroDB.bit/) #database #WIP

    Visual editor to create Dbschema files.
4.  [ZeroFrame Router](/1K2myjtjoEVpRC2JMieRL73ES4V4iLP2Ev/?/) #vue.js

    A very basic router that works with the ZeroFrame API.

## Devs & Opensource Projects

1.  [HelloZeroNet](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/) #official #python #coffeescript

    [[Gitlab repo]](https://gitlab.com/HelloZeroNet/)
    [[Git Center repo]](/1P4w4Rvh4vS9r6G5xTiSh8qEW87EKZtnJB/)

    Repos of all ZeroNet official zites
2.  [AnthyG](https://github.com/AnthyG/)
    *   ThunderWave [[Git Center repo]](/1EjXEyudstY8dN3F8V5od9KoS1bkAerz9x/) #chatroom
    *   R_MD_ZN_Blog

        A beautiful Responsive Material-Design Blog for the ZeroNet
1. [Antilibrary.bit-ZeroNet-UI](https://github.com/antilibrary/Antilibrary.bit-ZeroNet-UI) #book-repo

   Front-End source code for the site Antilibrary.bit on ZeroNet
3.  [Kaffiene](https://github.com/April93/Kaffiene)

    ZeroNet search engine
4.  [Kopy Kate](https://github.com/kopy-kate/kopy-kate)

    Online streaming torrents based on WebTorrent and ZeroNet 
5.  [Krixano](https://github.com/krixano/) #vue.js
    *   ZeroNet Dev Center
    *   ZeroMedium [[Git Center repo]](/1BEPbMfV8QtaZCD2cPNbabfDKnmhTAZRPx)
    *   ZeroFrame Router
    *   ZeroDB [[Git Center repo]](/19t2vGe6Vmkou1rhJDjpsQoW8aCD2EWEFC/)
    *   Important Zites
6.  [mkg2001](https://github.com/mkg20001)
    *   ZeroNetJS #WIP

        A JS version of ZeroNet, using libp2p.
    *   ZeroNet-kivy #official #android #WIP
    *   [mkg20001's Git(Hub) Mirror](/1F7b27kT38nMYZQg7tvDr33qWDZQgwnQpw/)

        a small Git(Hub) mirror, where mirrors the Git projects of some people/organizations
1. [Money-Network](https://github.com/jaros1/Money-Network)

   Demo with complementary and alternative money. Implemented in ZeroNet and AngularJS. Focus on privacy, encryption, max data in client and min data on ZeroNet. Work in progress.
1.  [MuxZeroNet](https://github.com/MuxZeroNet)
    * ZeroMux

       Real time video transmuxing and streaming library designed for ZeroNet (Probably deprecated in favor of official big file support).
    * zerolib #WIP

      A Minimalist ZeroNet Protocol Library
1. [poster](https://github.com/grez911/poster) [[Git Center repo]](/173jgCe7oqQQAG8V4dNEDyHY4mFFWJKF1Q)

    A simple blog platform for ZeroNet written from scratch using Vue.js and Bulma.
1. [rllola](https://github.com/rllola)
  * zeroTube
  * zeronet-torrent-plugin
  * nanos-zeronet-app #incomplete

        POC application that allow you to create and to sign your ZeroNet website updates using the Ledger Nano S.
1.  Sorasumi Sayo  (空澄砂夜)
    *  [ZeroGreeter](/1Ps8mZHcKGdwtjmMLBJ9b8KU6ogEBrjEig) #vue.js

        ZeroHello alternative (source code is also available [in the zite](/presto.greeter.bit) folder)
    *  [0-Gallery](/1GdpMUiHj52rNburTfYwHP5qxBz6HPyvYy)

        User fully controls her/his own gallery by creating personal hub.
    *  [Sakana](/15Z4H5K8YxjqGWpPxMLHWwr6Ve2nR7dz8d)

        Yet another ZeroMe frontend. The UI is similar to Mastodon.
7.  [zer0net](https://github.com/zer0net)
    *   ZeroVoat #reddit-like
    *   IFS

        Intergalactic File Server, archive.org alternative.
8.  [ZeroNerds](https://github.com/ZeroNerds)
    *   ZeroMeReloaded

        Enhanced ZeroMe
    *   HelloZeroProxy

        Enhanced ZeroHello for clearnet proxy
9.  [ZeroMusic](https://github.com/Emeraude/ZeroMusic) #basic #coffeescript
1. [ZeroNetLabs](https://github.com/ZeroNetLabs)
    * ZeroWiki
    * kopi

       Kopi is a ZeroNet boilerplate with all the necessary elements to start a new project without the need to configure and develop the same features again and again.
1.  [Zirch](https://gitlab.com/liberit/zirch) #search-engine

## Dev Blogs
1. [ekaterina@blog](/1Kp5xdjQyrPth5mEJsn6NDBKZxcaeYz86N/)
  * ZeroDart #WIP

   ZeroNet support for Google's Dart programming language
  * ZeroQuotes
  * ZeroTodes
  * ZeroPolls
1. [Kaffie's Blog](/blog.kaffie.bit/)

   Kaffiene search engine and more.
1. [RVRE Blog](/1KxfpG5ssLZxorjR34GW1Zw9oWZBVL4VRi/) #search-engine
1. [ZeroBlog Lab](/1CiDoBP8RiWziqiBGEd8tQMy66A6fmnw2V/)

  ZeroMux blog and more.

topic.title: Testing ZeroNet Dev News Bot
topic.body:
For ZeroNet fellows who have no habit logging in and checking centralized websites and services everyday ;)
I use another account for the bot, so if you find it annoying, simply mute it.
-
Currently the bot keeps fetching commits, issues and PRs from ZeroNet official github repos, 5 items or less per hour for every address. If there are more than 5 items, one of the items will add 'and more' in the title.
-
ZeroTalk default limit of data.json is 50k, so old items will be removed automatically.
-
Hope it will be useful for some devs :)

30/10/17 Add unofficial repos listed in [ZeroNet Dev Resources Index](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1509171908_1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h/Yet+another+ZeroNet+Dev+Resources+Index), if some devs want to add or remove their repos from my bot, please leave me a message. Also I seldom check ZeroMail, because it's too slow on a Raspi2.

1_1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h.body:
> [shellbound](#comment_24_1H1SHzxnPJS3hBbKvfXLqf4QJnXEUgaVe9): Has some issues on ZeroMePlus but seems to work well otherwise... thanks ;)

ZeroMePlus added ;)

> [shellbound](#comment_25_1H1SHzxnPJS3hBbKvfXLqf4QJnXEUgaVe9): Ahh, there we go.. awesome job! ;)

Thx :D

> [martinv](#comment_1_18cSYDgTfMB255SDgQM9EuoyWu78MhWfNj): Not exactly the same, but you can also use a browser plugin like "High contrast" for Chrome, which inverts the colors giving a similar result.https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/high-contrast/djcfdncoelnlbldjfhinnjlhdjlikmph

I'm also using a plugin named Colorfic in Icecat (Firefox's niece) that has similar function, but that's always not better than well-handcrafted theme ;) Hope that ZeroNet will officially provide dark theme soon.

2_1PniNzyi8fygvwyBaLpA9oBDVWZ5fXuJUw.body: Maybe it's better to create a specific English forum, and just keep the main forum multi-languages supported. Anyway, like what @mi6agent seems to express, we still can't list all languages on the navbar. And I guess it's better to have one with multi languages support :) For example, it helps everyone to learn or just perceive different cultures.

> [border0464fred](#comment_119_18XR5C5AxGfD5s2DbCPGuXxVN5oscoLyD6): I think the first time you load  main it have a yellow message that stipulate that main is english. If everyone start to speak his own language Zerotalk will hell of a mess. [...]

But it doesn't work very well, thus this topic pops up. So we may need a better solution. Better filtering or banning solution, create another, or just ignore them.

1_164x9q7LJPLX4SMbhqLPraKAGZRPa2gTFe.body:
> [nofish](#comment_931_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): There is not much yet. I'm planning to do a tutorial on it. Any ideas what kind of site you want to see in it?

I'm trying to write a messaging plugin (like disque I guess) for my Jekyll site. For further development I'd like to make it easy to install for any sites, and they can communicate with each other by merger-hubs. I know that IFS and ZeroVerse (experimenting) can share media files by Merged:CDN. So I hope that the tutorial will have some part related to this: different sites can share the same user database by merger site.

> [antyhrabia](#comment_36_1L5rGDgTs4W2V7gekSvJNhKa7XaHkVwotD): Sorry for offtopic, but I correct understand - you used Jekyll to generate site on ZeroNet? I tried put my site from Jekyll and it didnt want to work on ZeroNet.
[Example and tutorial](/1ADGCZCvC6wCf5GwCY23H9uwKyRiixoLt6/tutorial/2017/06/22/how-to-create-a-jekyll-site.html)

8_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj.body:
> [wrench](#comment_3_1KtGicZG6oM7qTvNE6nW4qbXkNjSo2vifT): The ZeroNet Documentation is available here : http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HP65eGEEMPbyzH3mkaoQ7eCMKd9P8G61W/ Share !

Why is google-analytics javascript included :(

> [wrench](#comment_4_1KtGicZG6oM7qTvNE6nW4qbXkNjSo2vifT): Because it was copied with HTTrack

I see... It's included in the readthedocs.io website. Anyway, thank you for the work :) though there is already [one in ZeroNet](/17Kom2G5qNDc6NaQwv445h1gFzxkY3ZtZe), without google-analytics.

> [wrench](#comment_6_1KtGicZG6oM7qTvNE6nW4qbXkNjSo2vifT): I tested the page with Ghostery but he doesn't detect it

Look like there are two resources:
```
./readthedocs-dynamic-include.js:11:ga.src = ('https:' == document.location.protocol ? 'https://ssl' : 'http://www') + '.google-analytics.com/ga.js';
./fonts/Inconsolata.html:262:    ga.src = ('https:' == document.location.protocol ? 'https://ssl' : 'http://www') + '.google-analytics.com/ga.js';
```
You can also try to modify readthedocs-dynamic-include.js (it seems to include another third-party js: zeronet.disque.com., and make it completely a zero net site

> [wrench](#comment_7_1KtGicZG6oM7qTvNE6nW4qbXkNjSo2vifT): Readthedocs-dynamic-include.js is required for the site?

No. You can remove it. I referred to the wrong js. The one includes zeronet.disque.com is ./docs.js, guess it's also safe to be removed. Then you can remove thess two lines in ./index.html `<script src="docs.js"></script>`, `<script src="readthedocs-dynamic-include.js"></script>`, and sign and publish the site.

> [ijse](#comment_1_1N3PjG79QtJEviXTaC28e4372TGbhi3sWd): How can I visit ZeroNet on iOS?

[ZeroNet Mobile Guide](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:7_1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h).

> [amuza](#comment_14_1NF9DMeY1kNvm7yNDcxkVgZ2Y9Jc893bgA): Greetingz! [...]

For the first question,  you can either use another browser to block all other connection except ZeroNet (For Firefox, in Setting -> Advanced -> Connection: set a fake proxy and exclude 127.0.0.1:43110, click use proxy for DNS (I use Torbrowser in this way).
Solution 2 is to use umatrix add-on, it can be set to block all kinds of things until you allow them.

For the second question, if you solved the first question,  then JavaScript server side is also in your computer, except some rare cases like a ZeroNet site owner sets up encryption to store your activities into secret string and only s/he can decrypt it (ridiculous idea I guess, but take care of ZeroNet site that provides encryption service), JavaScript can't do anything harmful I guess.

1_14LA8sy5pK11V4azVA9wTmMpu1VYCqT822.body:
> [johnscott623](#comment_1_1KUiGNi1RcRg79ji8L6pBQnCsBgkiKdoUV): I just installed this, too. I noticed in my package manager about 10 minutes ago that there was a ZeroNet package and I was like, "What's ZeroNet?" And here I am :)

I just checked my package manager on [Parabola](https://wiki.parabola.nu/Repositories#pcr), and found it too :D
```
$ pacaur -Ss zeronet
pcr/zeronet-git r1080-1
    Decentralized websites using Bitcoin crypto and the BitTorrent network.
aur/zeronet 0.5.6-1 (45, 3,03)
    Decentralized websites using Bitcoin crypto and the BitTorrent network.
aur/zeronet-git 0.5.6-1 (19, 0,16)
    Decentralized websites using Bitcoin crypto and the BitTorrent network.
```
Which system/distro are you using?

7_1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h.body:
> [antyhrabia](#comment_45_1L5rGDgTs4W2V7gekSvJNhKa7XaHkVwotD): I have problem: For me link for zerotalk moile isn't working. When I go in it I see "Not found" and when I click zeronet-mobile.userstyle it`s say [...]

[Load the main site first](/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/)

> [antyhrabia](#comment_46_1L5rGDgTs4W2V7gekSvJNhKa7XaHkVwotD): I have added your blog logn ago. Post numer 38 for Zerotalk doesnt exist. 

Then you need to update the site to get the new files.

> [gomzik](#comment_2_1F6BMqittjWUStzUbRXm2kG2GQ3RdBLqFQ): Also zeronet can be accessed trough Termux on android (no root needed)

Thx for the tip! I found a [Termux-ZeroNet script](https://github.com/PeterCxy/Termux-ZeroNet), look quite easy to use. Added to the tutorial :)

Edit: Add alarm for ZeroNet-kivy Android app. Currently ZeroNet-kivy stores sensitive data like your users.json as well as your private keys in the internal storge, which can be read by any other apps that have "internel storage" permission. So only use it for testing. Thx shouko for sharing it.

1_1BXCYRHwwev9cdgoMdWvhgKrMvUp19p2R2.body:
You can use [this userstyle](/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/?Post:36) as a partial solution. Fix feed list, site list is not lazy loaded, so may be still laggy.
Edit: You can also simply decrease the browser width to about 950px to get the independant scroll feature.

You may try to change all the value `"serving": true` to `"serving": false` in the `/path/to/zeronet/data/sites.json` and only resume the sites you want to keep updating from the site list panel. Remember to backup the file first before directly modify it.

> [adb](#comment_11_1BXCYRHwwev9cdgoMdWvhgKrMvUp19p2R2): This proxy  seems stored over 3000 zeronet sites  too, but browser works fine when it visit ZeroNet homepage.

The dev console shows it has about 704 sites, and it's already a bit laggy in my browser.

4_195Xafx3aZsxtngKo7D3XWgByQ5rYJX1C.body:
> [jlxip](#comment_24_195Xafx3aZsxtngKo7D3XWgByQ5rYJX1C): Seems to be working right now, I've just improved the code I'd written a few minutes ago so this shouldn't happen. Let me know whether it works for you.

Works perfectly!

3_1CvyxRucf7BbDvGtFe5LayTS2qX88VN7Er.body:
> [krixano](#comment_100_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): All seem to work with Firefox nightly for me.

I try again and now they all works on Iridium, I must miss sth before. On Icecat and Torbrowser they still don't work, probably some functions are not supported on Firefox ESR 52.

> [ivanq](#comment_77_1CvyxRucf7BbDvGtFe5LayTS2qX88VN7Er): That's strange as everything works for me. I think that the problem is in libraries. CoffeeScript compiler, Vue and other libraries weren't downloaded by ZeroNet yet. (That's 8MB after all.) If you wait a bit more, everything should work. [...]

~~I'm quite sure it's just that some functions are not supported in Icecat (based on Firefox ESR 52), my Torbrowser (based on Firefox ESR 45), I have also tried Iceweasel (based on Firefox 46) and it works well, for both Vue.js and Nofish's example.~~
After I disable Noscript plugin, they work on Icecat and Torbrowser now, so the problem is from the plugin XD

The console didn't show any error, the html code for the script is inside the Inspector but the script is not in the Debugger, in contrast the script shows in the Debugger in Iceweasel.

Not a problem to me anymore. Just a small compatibility issue, you can ignore it :)

1_1GhYpibzrzQ9FZTeoeHxG297hgcqcv71X2.body:
> [akito](#comment_309_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY): English is the world language. It deserves to be accessed as easily. If people access it wrongly without reading the warning signs under every post that says PLEASE POST IN ENGLISH ONLY, then it is the poster's fault, not the developer's.

What if the poster doesn't understand English at all? Like many Mandarin, Spanish native speakers, as well as they have a larger population than English native speakers [[Ref:wiki]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_languages_by_number_of_native_speakers)

I think it's incorrect to blame users, this issue is more about web design flaw and the complexity of solving it.
And we certainly need a ZeroNet-dev only sub-board where devs can follow and discuss things related to ZeroNet development @Nofish

> [akito](#comment_318_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY): ZeroTalk is designed very good as it is right now. Nothing should be changed about it, because the issues aren't the forum's fault. People just need to understand their own language in the TOP BAR. Everyone can notice that and change with one single click in the top bar. Any moron can do that. Therefore I expect it from anyone who has manners. [...]

But it just doesn't work, it will probably take forever to make every human become a good citizen or community member, there are always some people of that kind. So if we really want to solve the problem, we need to solve it from the web design or the system.

> [akito](#comment_324_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY): Okay, so if you paint a picture and nobody understands it -- do you change your beautiful work or would you rather show it to people who actually understand it?

Well, I feel such a question a bit unrelated. Personally I try (and sometimes fail) to be respectful to any other when I post sth in the public place. But some people just post anything they like when they find an input box and a 'send' button ...

1509245587_1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3Waw.body: Update: Add unofficial repos listed in [ZeroNet Dev Resources Index](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1509171908_1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h/Yet+another+ZeroNet+Dev+Resources+Index), if some devs want to add or remove their repos from my bot, please leave me a message (or you can roll your own with [this script](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:6_1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h)). Also I seldom check ZeroMail, because it's too slow on a Raspi2.

1509171908_1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3Waw.body:

Sure! I can't believe that someone can still discover this thread. It's also [in ZeroWiki](/138R53t3ZW7KDfSfxVpWUsMXgwUnsDNXLP/?Page:devresources) and anyone can edit it. Git Center is already included in the "Tools & Dev Services" section ;)

1511798060_1R67TfYzNkCnh89EFfGmXn5LMb4hX.body:
Works great for me! Except some small issues: some videos have no peer and can't be played. For [this video](/12MVkvYGcRW6u2NYbpfwVad1oQeyG4s9Er/index.html?view:item+id:1_1MEqso53FzGtN3NRYPuDBBbNbP2tUFiR82_item_6+type:video), When I opened it, the page said it can't be downloaded, but after I clicked `Play Partial File`, it's playable. For [this video](/12MVkvYGcRW6u2NYbpfwVad1oQeyG4s9Er/index.html?view:item+id:1_1EhxWNwfNAsgyZo2sEivPTad4fbSxLthD2_6+type:video) it shows there are 5 peers, but still I can't play it.
FAQ/rules button, menu button are not clickable, guess they are still under development.
Also I've added dark theme support for the site. If anyone is interested, you can [find the introduction and download it from my Jekyll Zite](/1ADGCZCvC6wCf5GwCY23H9uwKyRiixoLt6/dark/theme/2017/06/22/zeronet-dark-theme.html) [[Screenshot on ZeroMe]](/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h/1511622624) [[Source code in Git Center]](/13zzNGxEXDeLxHEGZdG3mE7G8dChf45LrV)

Suggestion: I found that IFS sometimes totally misfunctioned and there were some obvious errors in the console. I think you need to create another zite for development, and only merge the update to the main zite when it has no serious errors.
For there are too many files in the zite, you may consider using Webpack to pack them, it can also speed up publishing and loading the zite. There is [a basic tutorial](/ZeroMedium.bit/?/1KJY9Soji7TbEVfisJHPvuzwzTMpAUDHf4/getting-started-with-webpack) in ZeroMedium.

I find that IFS has CSS resource from fonts.googleapis.com: `https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Lato:400,700,400italic,700italic&subset=latin`. It's better to copy it to the zite to keep it completely decentralized.

Description doesn't display in the video.
Add Comments to IFS cluster 1, but the comments are placed in IFS cluser 0, like [this video](/12MVkvYGcRW6u2NYbpfwVad1oQeyG4s9Er/index.html?view:item+id:1_1G27nKed7YQPtNxhH7DXoEKkmjj7Yq5D1x_item_26+type:video)

2_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY.body:
> [helium](#comment_109_1Pv5CdXMDJm5k5iAp4SVbutnMg2ue8e58p): SVG support, if it does not yet exist. Tagging. List of blog posts and their tags.

If you need tagging and TOC, you may like to try [ZeroBlog Plus](/15mSYzsDxzarssqtV1pFPKqoCTaLdjVB2f/).

> [caden](#comment_5_1NpjJ6CEfGa7sDx2VHEEnwrpiy8DXf1io8): Yes I want to customize the site. I want to add a header to the blog and change the background from white...

If you need a dark theme, you can use the `dark.css` in my blog: [My ZeroBlog Goes Dark Now](/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/?Post:59:My+ZeroBlog+Goes+Dark+Now).

> [caden](#comment_6_1NpjJ6CEfGa7sDx2VHEEnwrpiy8DXf1io8): I want to create something more like these two site themes. https://imgur.com/a/45tGq You can create sites like these with grapes. Is there a development site on Zeronet where people can go and put in a request for features to be added like grapes.js?

Those themes look beautiful! ZeroBlog source code is not hosted on ZeroNet. Either you can make a request in [the official github repo](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroBlog), or ask Nofish to submit ZeroBlog to [Git Center](/gitcenter.bit/), though I doubt if Nofish has time to deal with that issue.
You may like to ask the author of [Poster](https://github.com/grez911/poster) [[repo in Git Center]](/173jgCe7oqQQAG8V4dNEDyHY4mFFWJKF1Q) for it, s/he may be interested.

1512772714_16PUgFapj8pSnEnS1bcAGVRPtfwvQ.body:
> [tuckerotg](#comment_3_1R6r94yS1mCMLjuSb2bgsZ85rc4pCEGBJ): I'm having issues getting https to work with nginx, I set it all up like a normal website would work, but it seems like it requires more configuration than I expected.

Here is [the nginx config](/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/?Post:44) I'm using for my clearnet proxy. Then either enable multi-user plugin or add `auth_basic` like in Lxpz's example. Hope it help
